thread.title: Southern Lehigh field hockey team edges Pen Argyl in Colonial League semis
thread.title_full: Southern Lehigh field hockey team edges Pen Argyl in Colonial League semis

title: Southern Lehigh field hockey team edges Pen Argyl in Colonial League semis
text:
Complete Box Score Â» 
Southern Lehigh 2, Pen Argyl 1 -- Rapid recap 
Southern Lehigh High School's field hockey team scored twice in the first 18 minutes Monday night and held on for a 2-1 win over Pen Argyl in a Colonial League semifinal at Salisbury High School. 
Turning point : Meghan Reese scored off a corner on a direct insert from Justina Mendez just 2:08 into the game. The play gave the Spartans a tremendous burst of energy and was a very tough way for Pen Argyl to start. 
Top performer : In addition to her assist, Mendez also scored the Spartans' second goal on an assist from Maddie Arnold with 11:47 left in the first half. It turned out to be the decisive goal because Lexie Kilpatrick scored for Pen Argyl to slice the lead in half with 4:20 left in the game. 
What it means : Southern Lehigh advances to the Colonial League title game at 7 p.m. Wednesday back at Salisbury against the Moravian Academy - Bangor winner. Moravian, the top seed, dealt the Spartans their only loss, 3-1, back on Sept. 18. Overall, it was a solid showing for Pen Argyl, particularly in the second half, against a very noteworthy opponent.
